title: How to use “apparently” in a sentence - Quora

response.answer_text: “Apparently, you’re not ready to write this test” has the same meaning as “You don’t seem to be ready to write this test.” Dialogue at five o’clock: “It looks like Bob won’t get here by four o’clock like he said he would.” “Apparently not.” Here, the use of “apparently” is sarcastic, as in “Thank you, Captain Obvious.” But it also conveys a bit of disappointment that Bob didn’t show up. Your example, “Apparently, I can’t be responsible for everything” is also sarcastic. It’s something you’d say if you had all the work dumped on you, everyone else went home, and came back the next morning wondering why it wasn’t all done yet. “Apparently there was a bad storm on the east coast last night.” Here, “apparently” means that you’ve heard there was a bad storm but it hasn’t been confirmed yet. You could also say “It seems there was a bad storm on the east coast last night.” “Seem” and “appear” are often interchangeable. But when you say “A ghost appeared in front of me,” “appear” is the only one that works. It doesn’t mean “illusion” though. If you think it was one, you have to make that additionally clear. In this context “appear” means to materialize, or to take shape. “Suddenly, the whole solution appeared in my mind.”

Apparently is an adverb. Something which is apparent is something which can be seen (seen to be true). If you want to use apparently in a sentence, usually it is set off by a comma: Apparently, it is possible to carry an umbrella on the train. It is apparent (seen) because people can be observed on the train carrying umbrellas. It is also used when some indication can be seen that a certain fact is accurate - but you don’t actually KNOW - so you say ‘apparently’ which explains that, as far as you know - having seen or understood something - a third unknown ‘something’ is true - but you don’t know DIRECTLY - it is only APPARENTLY so - it appears to be so. Apparently, a poltergeist has been active in the locked library overnight (because items were moved or knocked over in a locked room). There may, of course, be a completely different reason, but (for the moment) a poltergeist seems (appears) to be the most likely explanation (until the hidden secret passage is discovered, that is).
